title: Makus
author: Makus
content: Hello guys with several wallets out there, I want to be sure make the right choice, because I have seen posts were members of this forum are complaining about some wallets and exchanges because of their unprofessional behavior.So my question is, apart from electrum wallet which other wallet is the safest for long term holding of bitcoin?. With the current reduction of price in Bitcoin, is it the best time to buy bitcoin or should I still wait for the dip?.Though I have seen some post talking about "buy now or wait for the dip" but the debating answers got me confused, so I need the final clarity from you guys.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: You may also consider going for a cold storage option on an airgapped device, like Electrum cold storage: https://electrum.readthedocs.io/en/latest/coldstorage.htmlOr just buy a hardware wallet like Passport (bitcoin-only) or Trezor (multicoins)If you want to buy bitcoin and hold in long term, it is good to buy now.

comments.body: Quote from: Makus on September 06, 2023, 08:00:50 AMSo my question is, apart from electrum wallet which other wallet is the safest for long term holding of bitcoin?. Electrum is a hot wallet, so if you are using electrum default hot wallet, then it isn't safe for long term holding. The safest wallet for hodling Bitcoin for the long term is wallets that are offline, wallets like hardware wallets or air-gapped wallets (of which you can create with electrum).Quote from: Makus on September 06, 2023, 08:00:50 AMWith the current reduction of price in Bitcoin, is it the best time to buy bitcoin or should I still wait for the dip?.DYOR. I think we are already in the dip and Bitcoin might not fall much lower than it is right now before the next bull run begins, so now seems a good time to buy Bitcoin for a cheaper price.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: You may be asking yourself what price you would be interested in buying at. But you must understand that the longer you wait for a profitable offer, the more time you lose if you prefer to invest using the DCA method. Check the history to make sure that even if you make a mistake with the price now, bitcoin will still grow over time. Therefore, if you have an amount that you do not need for some period of time, feel free to buy, but do not give up on any price fluctuation. We say investing is risky; however, with the correct calculation of your funds, you can always return them, even with some pluses.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: Choosing a safe wallet for long-term Bitcoin holding is crucial. Anyway, the safest wallet for long-term holding of Bitcoin is a hardware wallet like Ledger Nano S, Trezor Model One and Coldcard. And some other highly reputable wallets for long-term storage such as Paper Wallets, Cold Storage Wallets and Multisignature Wallets. And aside from electrum software wallet, there is also Mycelium and Green Wallet.Best time to buy Bitcoin? Well, it's challenging to predict price movements accurately.For a long-term investment, I would prefer dollar-cost averaging (DCA). A strategy that involves buying a fixed amount of Bitcoin at regular intervals regardless of price fluctuations. I avoid trying to time the market and benefit from both highs and lows over time. I think the current price may be a good entry point.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Makus on September 06, 2023, 08:00:50 AMSo my question is, apart from electrum wallet which other wallet is the safest for long term holding of bitcoin?. It may worth mentioning that electrum can give you complete security, only if you run it on an airgepped device.If you run electrum on an online device, there's always the chance of getting hacked.If you want to be completely secure and you can't have an airgapped device for any reason, you should go for a good hardware wallet. Quote from: BlackBoss_ on September 06, 2023, 08:18:46 AMBeside Electrum wallet, you can use Bitcoin Core, full node if you want best privacy with Tor connection, or prune node if you are not serious about privacy.Whether you a run a prune node or you keep the entire blockchain, it has nothing to do with level of privacy. Even if you run a prune node, you can still broadcast your transactions by yourself without relying on any third party.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: DVlog on September 06, 2023, 08:33:44 AM~snip~A hardware wallet is the safest one. When you express yourself in this way, then I can say that it is definitely not good advice, because it turns out that every hardware wallet is equally secure, which is simply not true. We are witnessing that what we considered safe yesterday becomes unsafe overnight, so we need to choose carefully which HW we will choose.I, for one, cannot say that a good HW is one that has the possibility to share the user's seed with third parties, but I cannot say that a good HW is one that has an irreparable vulnerability that, if not properly patched by the user, allows possible attackers to extract the seed for less than 5 minutes in case he gets physical access to the device.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: Electrum wallet is still good for new crypto investors if they can't afford an open-source hardware wallet like Trezor but a hardware wallet is still better and more secured than every other wallets available, I have an Electrum wallet that I still use since 2016 and till today I still use it to move my Bitcoin around.I will like to warn you though, do not keep a lot of money on any wallet apart from hardware wallets, if you can afford to invest a thousand dollars on Bitcoin you can afford a hardware wallet easily. Keep this in mind and make sure it's part of your plan in the neartes future, as many people somehow feel relaxed after using mobile wallets for a while, thinking nothing can go wrong with the wallet.
